snippet: Why the first wave of entrance poll data is too unreliable to be released by The Times.
abstract: Why the first wave of entrance poll data is too unreliable to be released by The Times.
lead_paragraph: Within an hour or so, we'll be getting results about Iowa voters' preferences from interviews that are known as "entrance polls" -- similar to the exit polls conducted for primaries in other states. Edison Research of Somerville, N.J. stations interviewers at a random number of caucus sites, and they ask voters before they head inside to fill out questionnaires about their choices for a presidential candidate, and their positions on other issues.
